name: Rebound
text: Change the target of target spell that targets only a player. The new target must be a player.

editions.flavor: Insult, like an arrow, is beyond control once loosed.

name: Rebuff the Wicked
text: Counter target spell that targets a permanent you control.

editions.flavor:
"I cannot teach you their brand of magic, but I can teach you how to defend against it."
—Tavalus, priest of Korlis

name: Rebuild
text:
Return all artifacts to their owners' hands.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Rebuke
text: Destroy target attacking creature.

editions.flavor:
"No one chooses to be stitched together into a skaab. If it could speak, it would beg for its own destruction."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

"No one chooses to be stitched together into a skaab. If it could speak, it would beg for its own destruction."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Rebuking Ceremony
text: Put two target artifacts on top of their owners' libraries.

editions.flavor: From the Radix at the hub of the Tangle all the way out to the Edges of Forgetting, a Viridian elf's life is built around the temporary.

name: Recall
text: Discard X cards, then return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each card discarded this way. Exile Recall.

name: Recantation
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Recantation.
{U}, Sacrifice Recantation: Return up to X target permanents to their owners' hands, where X is the number of verse counters on Recantation.

name: Reciprocate
text: Exile target creature that dealt damage to you this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Just as the noble soul calls virtue to itself, the evil soul summons harm."
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

"Just as the noble soul calls virtue to itself, the evil soul summons harm."
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

name: Reckless Abandon
text:
As an additional cost to cast Reckless Abandon, sacrifice a creature.
Reckless Abandon deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: The climax of a warlord's career is always death.
The climax of a warlord's career is always death.

name: Reckless Assault
text: {1}, Pay 2 life: Reckless Assault deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"How will you fight an enemy that cares nothing for itself?"
—The Blind Seer

name: Reckless Brute
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Reckless Brute attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: His mind knows no fear, registering only the burning impulse to destroy.

name: Reckless Bushwhacker
text:
Surge {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its surge cost if you or a teammate has cast another spell this turn.)
Haste
When Reckless Bushwhacker enters the battlefield, if its surge cost was paid, other creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain haste until end of turn.

name: Reckless Charge
text:
Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Reckless Cohort
text: Reckless Cohort attacks each combat if able unless you control another Ally.

editions.flavor: "You have a family. Mine died at Sea Gate. You go to yours, and I'll go to mine."

name: Reckless Embermage
text: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to itself.

editions.flavor: Many mages have been consumed by their work.
Those who play with fire are bound to get burned.
Many mages have been consumed by their work.

name: Reckless Fireweaver
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, Reckless Fireweaver deals 1 damage to each opponent.

editions.flavor: Architects find inspiration in the dragon's beauty of form, while artificers are influenced by the function of its fire.

name: Reckless Imp
text:
Flying
Reckless Imp can't block.
Dash {1}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

name: Reckless Ogre
text: Whenever Reckless Ogre attacks alone, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: There is no such thing as a regiment of ogres.

name: Reckless One
text:
Haste
Reckless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Goblins on the battlefield.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
editions.flavor: "Release chaos with me!"
"Release chaos with me!"
"Release chaos with me!"

name: Reckless Racer
text:
First strike
Whenever Reckless Racer becomes tapped, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Illegal street races turned out to be perfect practice for avoiding Consulate patrols.

name: Reckless Reveler
text: {R}, Sacrifice Reckless Reveler: Destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor:
"The gods of Theros are born of the expectations and beliefs of mortals. If I have found godhood, what does that say about their true desires?"
—Xenagos, god of revels

name: Reckless Scholar
text: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card.

editions.flavor: Progress comes at a price.
"Any good prospector must sift the gold from the sand."
"Any good prospector must sift the gold from the sand."

name: Reckless Spite
text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.

editions.flavor:
"Death is such an exquisite sensation."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

"My plan's elegance leads my enemies to believe it is spite that fuels me."
—Volrath
"The end is justified in being mean. Or something like that."
"The end is justified in being mean. Or something like that."

name: Reckless Waif
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Reckless Waif.

editions.flavor: "Yes, I'm alone. No, I'm not worried."

name: Reckless Wurm
text:
Trample
Madness {2}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

editions.flavor: Bred for battle in the Grand Coliseum, these wurms annihilated whole ecosystems when released into the wild.
Bred for battle in the Grand Coliseum, these wurms annihilated whole ecosystems when released into the wild.

name: Reclaim
text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.

editions.flavor: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.
The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.
The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.
The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.
The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.

name: Reclaiming Vines
text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

editions.flavor: "This world tires of its long occupation."—Nissa Revane

name: Reclamation
text: Black creatures can't attack unless their controller sacrifices a land for each black creature he or she controls that's attacking. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

editions.flavor:
"We shall oppose Lim-Dûl and his forces by any means necessary, even if the very earth be torn asunder."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

name: Reclamation Sage
text: When Reclamation Sage enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor: "What was once formed by masons, shaped by smiths, or given life by mages, I will return to the embrace of the earth."
"What was once formed by masons, shaped by smiths, or given life by mages, I will return to the embrace of the earth."
"What was once formed by masons, shaped by smiths, or given life by mages, I will return to the embrace of the earth."

name: Reclusive Artificer
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
When Reclusive Artificer enters the battlefield, you may have it deal damage to target creature equal to the number of artifacts you control.

name: Reclusive Wight
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control another nonland permanent, sacrifice Reclusive Wight.

editions.flavor: There are places so horrible that even the dead hide their faces.

name: Recoil
text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand. Then that player discards a card.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: Anything sent into a plagued world is bound to come back infected.
Anything sent into a plagued world is bound to come back infected.

name: Recollect
text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor:
"The bones of the past will tell their tales—if you know how to speak their language."
—Savra

"The bones of the past will tell their tales—if you know how to speak their language."
—Savra

name: Reconnaissance
text: {0}: Remove target attacking creature you control from combat and untap it.

editions.flavor: War favors the informed.

name: Reconstruction
text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.
Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.
Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.

name: Recoup
text:
Target sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost. (Mana cost includes color.)
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Recover
text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: As Barrin exhumed his daughter's body, he finally realized the full price of his faith in Urza.
"Wisdom from the past is best gathered directly from the source."
As Barrin exhumed his daughter's body, he finally realized the full price of his faith in Urza.

name: Recross the Paths
text: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a land card. Put that card onto the battlefield and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order. Clash with an opponent. If you win, return Recross the Paths to its owner's hand. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Recruiter of the Guard
text: When Recruiter of the Guard enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card with toughness 2 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Before a cause can have supporters, it has to have a voice.

name: Recumbent Bliss
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may gain 1 life.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: Kithkin somnomancers enjoy the peaceful dreams wafting from their victims.
Kithkin somnomancers enjoy the peaceful dreams wafting from their victims.

name: Recuperate
text:
Choose one —
• You gain 6 life.
• Prevent the next 6 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Rise once more, so you may continue to destroy our enemies."
—Karona, false god

name: Recurring Insight
text:
Draw cards equal to the number of cards in target opponent's hand.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

name: Recurring Nightmare
text: Sacrifice a creature, Return Recurring Nightmare to its owner's hand: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor:
"I am confined by sleep and defined by nightmare."
—Crovax

"I am confined by sleep and defined by nightmare."
—Crovax

"I am confined by sleep and defined by nightmare."
—Crovax

name: Recycle
text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you play a card, draw a card.
Your maximum hand size is two.

name: Red Cliffs Armada
text: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

editions.flavor: By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than seven thousand warships on the Yangtze.
By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than 7,000 warships on the Yangtze.

name: Redeem
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn to up to two target creatures.

editions.flavor:
"That they are saved from death is immaterial. What is important is that they know the source of their benefaction."
—Radiant, archangel

"Let me redeem my brothers both from death."
—William Shakespeare, Titus Andronicus

name: Redeem the Lost
text: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn. Clash with an opponent. If you win, return Redeem the Lost to its owner's hand. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Red Elemental Blast
text:
Choose one —
• Counter target blue spell.
• Destroy target blue permanent.

name: Red-Hot Hottie
text: Whenever Red-Hot Hottie deals damage to a creature, put a third-degree-burn counter on that creature. It has "At the end of each turn, sacrifice this creature unless you scream ‘Aaah' at the top of your lungs."

editions.flavor: She was winning the Dominarian "Are You Hot?" competition until disaster struck during the wet T-shirt round.

name: Redirect
text: You may choose new targets for target spell.

editions.flavor:
"Your strategy is marvelous. I've just made a few minor adjustments."
—Veris, watcher of Indi Keep

"It's actually quite simple, but since you've only recently begun to walk upright, it may take some time to explain."
—Jace Beleren, to Garruk Wildspeaker

"It's actually quite simple, but since you've only recently begun to walk upright, it may take some time to explain."
—Jace Beleren, to Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Red Mana Battery
text:
{2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Red Mana Battery.
{T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Red Mana Battery: Add {R} to your mana pool, then add an additional {R} to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.

name: Red Scarab
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by red creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as an opponent controls a red permanent.

name: Red Sun's Zenith
text: Red Sun's Zenith deals X damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead. Shuffle Red Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.

name: Reduce
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

name: Reduce in Stature
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has base power and toughness 0/2.

editions.flavor: A dragon learns humility only in the moments before its death.

name: Reduce to Ashes
text: Reduce to Ashes deals 5 damage to target creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

editions.flavor: Previously the training center for cathars, the Elgaud Grounds are now used by the Lunarch Inquisition to punish those considered to be heretics.

name: Reduce to Dreams
text: Return all artifacts and enchantments to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor:
"This world is a dream. We cling to our toys like children, but sooner or later we must learn to live without them."
—Sensei Hisoka

name: Red Ward
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from red. This effect doesn't remove Red Ward.

editions.flavor: The soldiers chopped and chopped, and still the great tree stood, frowning down at them.
The soldiers chopped and chopped, and still the great tree stood, frowning down at them.

And would you strip the bark from a treefolk?
—Elvish expression meaning
"Are you crazy?"

"In the heart of Llanowar the magic is so strong that trees cannot stay rooted."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

name: Reef Pirates
text: Whenever Reef Pirates deals damage to an opponent, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Zeki sails with a dead crew not out of villainy, but pragmatism."
—Baron Sengir

"Corpses for crew don't sit well with me. Zeki and his dead ship had best keep their distance."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable
Relentless as the tides, souls dark as a moonless night. Bloodshed on their minds, and greed burning in their hearts like molten gold.

name: Reef Shaman
text: {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

editions.flavor: With one gesture, she can render a thousand years of navigational charts obsolete.

name: Reef Worm
text: When Reef Worm dies, create a 3/3 blue Fish creature token with "When this creature dies, create a 6/6 blue Whale creature token with ‘When this creature dies, create a 9/9 blue Kraken creature token.'"

name: Reflect Damage
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage this turn, that damage is dealt to that source's controller instead.

editions.flavor:
From you to me, so me to you.
—Femeref children's taunt

name: Reflecting Mirror
text: {X}, {T}: Change the target of target spell with a single target if that target is you. The new target must be a player. X is twice the converted mana cost of that spell.

name: Reflecting Pool
text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type that a land you control could produce.

editions.flavor: Does it reflect the future that once was or the past that can never be?

"The reflection of land interests me far more than its reality."
—Volrath
Does it reflect the future that once was or the past that can never be?

name: Reflector Mage
text: When Reflector Mage enters the battlefield, return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand. That creature's owner can't cast spells with the same name as that creature until your next turn.

name: Reflexes
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

editions.flavor:
"Here's how ya win. Don't let the other guy hit back first."
—Jula, goblin raider

"Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."
—Combat trainer

"Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."
—Combat trainer

name: Reflex Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have haste.

editions.flavor:
"This sliver comes into the world a perfect predator. It's ready to hunt and devour its first meal within seconds of hatching."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Refocus
text:
Untap target creature.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Before you can open your third eye, you must prove you can open the first two."

name: Reforge the Soul
text:
Each player discards his or her hand, then draws seven cards.
Miracle {1}{R} (You may cast this card for its miracle cost when you draw it if it's the first card you drew this turn.)

editions.flavor: In a wave of spells called the Cursemute, Avacyn cleansed the world with divine fire.
In a wave of spells called the Cursemute, Avacyn cleansed the world with divine fire.

name: Refraction Trap
text:
If an opponent cast a red instant or sorcery spell this turn, you may pay {W} rather than pay Refraction Trap's mana cost.
Prevent the next 3 damage that a source of your choice would deal to you and/or permanents you control this turn. If damage is prevented this way, Refraction Trap deals that much damage to target creature or player.

name: Refresh
text:
Regenerate target creature.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
Death is a moth that dances toward our inner flame. The brightest fire can singe its wings.
—Nantuko teaching

name: Refreshing Rain
text:
If an opponent controls a Swamp and you control a Forest, you may cast Refreshing Rain without paying its mana cost.
Target player gains 6 life.

name: Refurbish
text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"There's no reason to buy a new one when I've got the tools to fix the one you've got."
—Ripu, repair specialist

name: Regal Behemoth
text:
Trample
When Regal Behemoth enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
Whenever you tap a land for mana while you're the monarch, add one mana of any color to your mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

name: Regal Caracal
text:
Other Cats you control get +1/+1 and have lifelink.
When Regal Caracal enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 white Cat creature tokens with lifelink.

editions.flavor: Oketra's closest viziers are known as her chosen, though others may have a better claim to that moniker.

name: Regal Force
text: When Regal Force enters the battlefield, draw a card for each green creature you control.

editions.flavor: It rarely moves, standing stock still in its clearing. When it does stir, ravens stop their cawing and crickets their chirping. All of nature watches in awed silence.
It rarely moves, standing stock still in its clearing. When it does stir, ravens stop their cawing and crickets their chirping. All of nature watches in awed silence.
Unicorns don't care if you believe in them any more than you care if they believe in you.
Unicorns don't care if you believe in them any more than you care if they believe in you.
It stalks the Regathan highlands, leaving behind melted snow, scorched earth, and the charred corpses of would-be temple robbers.

name: Regenerate
text: Regenerate target creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

editions.flavor: "This wound shall be like the chills of winter: swiftly forgotten when spring shoots rise."

name: Regeneration
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

editions.flavor:
"Faith in Freyalise has given me the gift, not the curse, of unprecedented longevity."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

"Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid

"Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid

"A touch of vine sap in the blood, and the flesh knits as quickly as new roots twining."
—Freyalise

"Death is not a debt I am yet willing to pay."
—Purraj of Urborg

name: Regicide
text:
Reveal Regicide as you draft it. The player to your right chooses a color, you choose another color, then the player to your left chooses a third color.
Destroy target creature that's one or more of the colors chosen as you drafted cards named Regicide.

editions.flavor: "You're done!"

name: Regress
text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"Never look too deep, where the waters turn dark. What the sea has hidden there may not stay down forever."
—Jaby, Silundi Sea nomad

"Once cast, a spell can be undone. But once revealed, a secret can never again be kept."
—Pontifex, elder researcher

name: Regrowth
text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: While the root remains, the tree yet lives.

name: Reign of Chaos
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target Plains and target white creature.
• Destroy target Island and target blue creature.

editions.flavor:
"The Burning Isles are the home to a dozen lords who claim dominion. Jamuraa will look to only one leader: me."
—Kaervek

name: Reign of Terror
text: Destroy all green creatures or all white creatures. They can't be regenerated. You lose 2 life for each creature that died this way.

editions.flavor:
"I don't know what takes them; they die around me without time to scream."
—Scout Ekemet, final journal

name: Reign of the Pit
text: Each player sacrifices a creature. Create an X/X black Demon creature token with flying, where X is the total power of the creatures sacrificed this way.

name: Reincarnation
text: Choose target creature. When that creature dies this turn, return a creature card from its owner's graveyard to the battlefield under the control of that creature's owner.

editions.flavor:
"You cannot imagine what eyes you may look through tomorrow."
—Aerona, elder druid

name: Reinforced Bulwark
text:
Defender
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

editions.flavor: Built of wood and iron. Held together by hope and prayer.

name: Reinforcements
text: Put up to three target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.

editions.flavor:
"We aided the Balduvians once before. They need but ask and we shall do so again."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

"Let them send their legions I will show them that my truth is stronger than their swords."
—General Varchild

"Let them send their legions! I will show them that my truth is stronger than their swords."
—General Varchild

"Let them send their legions! I will show them that my truth is stronger than their swords."
—General Varchild

name: Reins of Power
text: Untap all creatures you control and all creatures target opponent controls. You and that opponent each gain control of all creatures the other controls until end of turn. Those creatures gain haste until end of turn.

text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
When enchanted creature dies, you may return Reins of the Vinesteed from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to a creature that shares a creature type with that creature.

name: Reiterate
text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor:
"Echoes of the Mirari's power yet linger."
—Zyd, Kamahlite druid

name: Reito Lantern
text: {3}: Put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.

editions.flavor: Lanterns carved from the mystic stones of the Reito Mines were said to light the way of lost souls.
Lanterns carved from the mystic stones of the Reito Mines were said to light the way of lost souls.

text:
Flying
When Reiver Demon enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, destroy all nonartifact, nonblack creatures. They can't be regenerated.

text:
You gain 6 life.

text:
Fading 2 (This artifact enters the battlefield with two fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{T}: You gain 2 life.

name: Rekindled Flame
text:
Rekindled Flame deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent has no cards in hand, you may return Rekindled Flame from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Reki, the History of Kamigawa
text: Whenever you cast a legendary spell, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"After his death, monks spent ten years transcribing the tattoos from Reki's body and gathering stories from those who spoke with him. Thus the volume you hold was written."
—The History of Kamigawa

name: Reknit
text: Regenerate target permanent.

editions.flavor:
"An axe may break upon a ribbon if the ribbon's will is the stronger."
—Awylla, elvish safewright
